body.name: The Fifth Kind: Arrival (Dark Nova Series Book 1)
body.description: A secret too terrible to keep. And too dangerous to reveal.In the depths of an ancient Egyptian tomb, archaeologists make a baffling discovery: the mummified body of a man clad in a space suit.Halfway around the globe, exobiologist Dr. Katherine Shepard and intelligence officer Colonel Devon Peters are summoned to the site of a downed UFO. To their amazement, they find one of the occupants alive. Even more shocking, he appears to be human.As Shepard and Peters delve deeper into the enigma, they expose a chilling truth: aliens have inhabited Earth far longer than anyone could have imagined, and they are not alone. An ancient, hidden war is being waged, with humanity’s survival hanging in the balance.Thrust into a perilous world of shifting allegiances and veiled motives, Shepard and Peters must race against time to decipher the aliens’ true intentions and shield humanity from a revelation too shocking to comprehend.The Fifth Kind is a gripping, high-octane hard science-fiction thriller that will leave you reading late into the night. Read more

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #2,013 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #9 in Technothrillers (Kindle Store) #9 in First Contact Science Fiction eBooks #9 in Hard Science Fiction (Kindle Store)

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: The UFO enigma has long confounded humanity. In a race against time, exobiologist Dr. Katherine Shepard and Colonel Devon Peters strive to decipher the intentions of an alien presence on Earth and safeguard humanity from an imminent and earth-shattering revelation.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A well thought out tale that keeps you from putting the book down.
reviews.reviewText: If you like science fiction then this book should be considered a must read. It keeps you engrossed in the plot and guessing the outcome of all the mini plots that are entwined with the main plot. I thoroughly enjoyed reading it and can’t wait until I can read the next book in the series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars As a though-provoking science fiction
reviews.reviewText: It has some interesting characters. It is a fun story, providing some novel what if... It explores dark matter, AI, and human consciousness. And feeds the human imagination with new conspiracies.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Fast paced with engaging characters. I enjoyed a new spin on potential for possible alien encounters.I would highly recommend to fans of this genre.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars another repeat of ufo stories
reviews.reviewText: the book is well written and interesting but it rehashes all that the numerous tv shows have aired and nothing new.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars The Fifth Kind Arrival
reviews.reviewText: Good read with some twists and turns. Definitely holds your attention. I'm hooked enough to read the next book in the series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars great science fiction
reviews.reviewText: I love the book !!!Great reading for anyone who loves science fiction.Maybe the authors is right, humans are easily manipulated, it could be that some aliens live among us😜

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Well written with complex characters
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed this novel. The characters were nicely developed and complex. The narration brought the images described to life in my mind.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It was good, not great but I liked it.
reviews.reviewText: The two different stories in one book were never my favorite. If they were were to be combined more I would have liked it better.
Couldn't put it down! Interesting from the first page - what if this happens in the future? Looking forward to the 2nd book in the series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The story is unusual for Kindle Unlimited in that it is very much a in-flight novel rather than quickly written novellas written to formulae that we normally see.It made an interesting usage of both the fear of bodysnatcher stories combined with the more conventional ufo ideas.It all works. There are some howlers, the order to launch F22s off an aircraft carrier stood out, for one example. Such things can be quickly fixed (hint subtract 4 for f18).Next stop book 2.
Really enjoyed the descriptive writing. The story takes some interesting twists and turns. Sci fi fans will love this read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: A thoroughly good read. Now waiting eagerly for book 2. J D Prescott is an author to follow. Well written.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Always enjoy sci-fi stories and this book is up there with the best,only put it down when me eyes get tired
